Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Build regression with MyDriving on master" (#2657) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Run "Restore;Build" target on MyDriving Android sample app (https://github.com/Azure-Samples/MyDriving/tree/master/src/MobileApps/MyDriving/MyDriving.Android)

### Actual Behavior

See attached binlog.

[MyDriving-Android_Restore-Build_123.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/files/2799615/MyDriving-Android_Restore-Build_123.zip)

### Version Information

Commercial monodroid master 2d8ca9e55ebe74513df8072b0096f372cf0dd890

Last known working build: monodroid d16-0-p2 9a258c4311ab578e2812ae1482b3f553482ccee3

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[docs] Update the build instructions for Windows" (#2656) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Context: https://gitter.im/xamarin/xamarin-android?at=5c4a25ba7a0f4d5b1900f7a4
Context: https://gitter.im/xamarin/xamarin-android?at=5c4a9d968ce4bb25b80795d3

Add environment setup instructions to make it easier for contributors to
make sure they have a Windows build environment that has the expected
build dependencies.  The instructions were a little confusing before
this because the [Build Dependencies][0] page doesn't have a dedicated
section about Windows.

Add a link to the [Using Your Build][1] page to make it easier for
contributors to find the next step about how to build a Xamarin.Android
application after they have built `Xamarin.Android.sln`.

Mention the (relatively new) `Xamarin.Android.Build.Tasks.sln` as a way
to work around output assembly file locking when working on the build
tasks on Windows.

[0]: https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/blob/master/Documentation/building/dependencies.md
[1]: https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/blob/master/Documentation/workflow/UsingYourBuild.md

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "DirectoryAssemblyResolver usage needs better error reporting" (#2655) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Context: https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/content/problem/414579/error-10.html

Remember commit 38c365bd449e5be305b5cb0e28b8aabb94ff6c60 / PR #1551 / Issue #1532, in which attempts to find an assembly which do not exist results in terrible error messages, a'la

> System.IO.FileNotFoundException: Could not load assembly 'Example'. Perhaps it doesn't exist in the Mono for Android profile?

The same "bad error message" scenario exists in `<ResolveLibraryProjectImports/>` as well.

All locations which "resolve assemblies" -- such as `DirectoryAssemblyResolver` -- should be reviewed to ensure that *useful* error messages are produced.  A `FileNotFoundException` is not usable.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Directory obj/Release-Prod/android/assets contains {nuget package}.dll but no debug symbols file was found" (#2654) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a new Xamarin Android project.
2. Add some nuget packages to it.
3. Update the project's .csproj file to have these property groups: [https://gist.github.com/justintoth/deaa2eb0f90029e19b3a69075a99bb27](https://gist.github.com/justintoth/deaa2eb0f90029e19b3a69075a99bb27)
4. Build the project.

### Expected Behavior

There shouldn't be hundreds of build warnings regarding nuget packages missing a debug symbols file.

### Actual Behavior

There are hundreds of build warnings regarding nuget packages missing a debug symbols file.

> /Users/justintoth/Documents/rpr-mobile/android-application/EXEC: Warning: Directory obj/Release-Prod/android/assets contains Glide.dll but no debug symbols file was found. (com.rpr.mobile.droid)
> /Users/justintoth/Documents/rpr-mobile/android-application/EXEC: Warning: Directory obj/Release-Prod/android/assets contains Java.Interop.dll but no debug symbols file was found. (com.rpr.mobile.droid)
> /Users/justintoth/Documents/rpr-mobile/android-application/EXEC: Warning: Directory obj/Release-Prod/android/assets contains LocalyticsXamarin.Android.dll but no debug symbols file was found. (com.rpr.mobile.droid)
> /Users/justintoth/Documents/rpr-mobile/android-application/EXEC: Warning: Directory obj/Release-Prod/android/assets contains LocalyticsXamarin.Shared.dll but no debug symbols file was found. (com.rpr.mobile.droid)
> /Users/justintoth/Documents/rpr-mobile/android-application/EXEC: Warning: Directory obj/Release-Prod/android/assets contains Microsoft.AppCenter.Analytics.Android.Bindings.dll but no debug symbols file was found. (com.rpr.mobile.droid)
> /Users/justintoth/Documents/rpr-mobile/android-application/EXEC: Warning: Directory obj/Release-Prod/android/assets contains Microsoft.AppCenter.Analytics.dll but no debug symbols file was found. (com.rpr.mobile.droid)
> /Users/justintoth/Documents/rpr-mobile/android-application/EXEC: Warning: Directory obj/Release-Prod/android/assets contains Microsoft.AppCenter.Android.Bindings.dll but no debug symbols file was found. (com.rpr.mobile.droid)
> /Users/justintoth/Documents/rpr-mobile/android-application/EXEC: Warning: Directory obj/Release-Prod/android/assets contains Microsoft.AppCenter.Crashes.Android.Bindings.dll but no debug symbols file was found. (com.rpr.mobile.droid)
> /Users/justintoth/Documents/rpr-mobile/android-application/EXEC: Warning: Directory obj/Release-Prod/android/assets contains Microsoft.AppCenter.Crashes.dll but no debug symbols file was found. (com.rpr.mobile.droid)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Android implementation of HTTPClient throwing up java.io.IOException " (#2651) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
_From @UnreachableCode on January 17, 2019 16:54_

I believe this relates to the bug detailed in Xamarin's old Bugzilla:
https://bugzilla.xamarin.com/show_bug.cgi?id=41100

and is also similar to the issue discussed here:
https://github.com/square/okhttp/issues/1517

Here is the main stacktrace of my issue:

LoginProvider+<LoginAsync>d__1.MoveNext () C:\source\repos\{MyApp}\{MyApp}\{MyApp}\Services\LoginProvider.cs:35
java.io.IOException: unexpected end of stream on Connection{testclarity.i-menzies.com:443, proxy=DIRECT@ hostAddress=62.244.173.166 cipherSuite=TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256 protocol=http/1.1} (recycle count=0)
com.android.okhttp.internal.http.HttpConnection.readResponse(HttpConnection.java:210)
com.android.okhttp.internal.http.HttpTransport.readResponseHeaders(HttpTransport.java:80)
com.android.okhttp.internal.http.HttpEngine.readNetworkResponse(HttpEngine.java:905)
com.android.okhttp.internal.http.HttpEngine.readResponse(HttpEngine.java:789)
com.android.okhttp.internal.huc.HttpURLConnectionImpl.execute(HttpURLConnectionImpl.java:443)
com.android.okhttp.internal.huc.HttpURLConnectionImpl.getResponse(HttpURLConnectionImpl.java:388)
com.android.okhttp.internal.huc.HttpURLConnectionImpl.getResponseCode(HttpURLConnectionImpl.java:501)
com.android.okhttp.internal.huc.DelegatingHttpsURLConnection.getResponseCode(DelegatingHttpsURLConnection.java:105)
com.android.okhttp.internal.huc.HttpsURLConnectionImpl.getResponseCode(HttpsURLConnectionImpl.java:25)
Caused by: java.io.EOFException: \n not found: size=0 content=...
com.android.okhttp.okio.RealBufferedSource.readUtf8LineStrict(RealBufferedSource.java:200)
com.android.okhttp.internal.http.HttpConnection.readResponse(HttpConnection.java:191)

I have tried setting the connection closed header and setting chunked transfer encoding but neither of these fixes work. I would try to set the OkHTTP.setRetryOnConnectionFailure(true) but I don't think there is a way to do this in the referenced Java source.

_Copied from original issue: dotnet/standard#1055_

2. Expand the packages section, and note that updates are available for System.Reactive and System.Reactive.Linq.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Can't upgrade to Xamarin.Android.Support 28.0.0.1 nuget packeges" (#2644) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Open a Xamarin Android app in Visual Studio for Mac.
2. Expand the nuget packages, and observe that there is a 28.0.0.1 update available for all Xamarin.Android.Support packages.
3. Try to update any of the packages.

### Expected Behavior

It will update the packages.

### Actual Behavior

It fails to update the packages.

> Unable to resolve dependencies. 'Xamarin.Android.Arch.Core.Common 26.1.0' is not compatible with 'Xamarin.Android.Arch.Core.Runtime 1.1.1.1 constraint: Xamarin.Android.Arch.Core.Common (= 1.1.1.1)', 'Xamarin.Android.Arch.Lifecycle.LiveData 1.1.1.1 constraint: Xamarin.Android.Arch.Core.Common (= 1.1.1.1)', 'Xamarin.Android.Arch.Lifecycle.LiveData.Core 1.1.1.1 constraint: Xamarin.Android.Arch.Core.Common (= 1.1.1.1)'.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[Xamarin.Android.Build.Tasks] Fix ILRepack to use `AfterBuild`." (#2653) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
When we changed over to use `CopyFilesToOutputDirectory` for the
`AfterTargets` value we forgot that we are still using `xbuild`
for building this branch. This results in the following warning

	Xamarin.Android.Build.Tasks.csproj:  warning : Target 'CopyFilesToOutputDirectory', not found in the project

which means the ILRepack does not run.

So this PR moves back to using `AfterBuild` for that value. This
should allow the `Xamarin.Android.Build.Tasks` assembly to be
properly repacked.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Build with Android NDK r19" (#2592) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
* Update gradle to version 5.1 (the latest version)
  * Update gradle android addin to 3.2.1 (required for r18+ as it removes
    dependency on the MIPS toolchain which no longer exists in r18+)
  * Bump all the instances of `android:minSdkVersion` to `16` since this is the
    lowest NDK API found in NDK r19 and, thus, the lowest API our runtimes can
    run on.
  * Fix AOT build tests by targetting API 16 at the minimum.
  * Introduce the `Xamarin.Android.Tools.XABuildConfig` class, generated at the
    XA build time, which includes all the necessary information about the NDK
    the native runtime was built with.
  * Put NDK and per-architecture mimum API level in
    `Xamarin.Android.Common.props` based on the contents of
    `build-tools/scripts/Ndk.targets`

Future bumps of NDK versions and per-architecture API levels will require
changing just a single file - `build-tools/scripts/Ndk.targets` - in order to
make the change visible and used by all the other parties.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Entry in ListView with DataTemplateSelector refocused after scrolled back onto screen" (#5076) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description
On Android, if a DataTemplateSelector is used with a custom ViewCell containing an Entry, the entry will refocus itself after being unfocused and scrolled off and back onto the screen. This will occur to any cell that has had focus previously, and the most recently scrolled onto screen will have the focus.

Issue does not occur when editors are used in place of entries.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Run attached sample
2. Set focus to an entry
3. Remove focus from the entry (via back button or other method)
4. Scroll previously focused cell off screen
5. Scroll cell back onto screen
6. Entry will have regained focus (without soft input)

### Expected Behavior
Entries in ViewCells do not gain focus after being unfocused

### Actual Behavior
Entry in ViewCell gains focus when scrolled back onto screen after unfocused

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: Xamarin.Forms 3.2.0.839982, Xamarin.Forms 3.5.0.1006868
- Last known good version: Xamarin.Forms 3.1.0.697729
- IDE: Visual Studio for Mac 7.7.3 (Build 43)
- Platform Target Frameworks:
  - Android: API version 9.0
- Android Support Library Version: 27.0.2.1
- Nuget Packages:
- Affected Devices: Samsung S9 (API 26), Android 4.4 simulator (API 19)

### Reproduction Link

[ListViewEntryFocusReproduction.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/files/2800567/ListViewEntryFocusReproduction.zip)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[iOS,Shell] Fix tab bar style color alignment to match Android" (#5075) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###

Android has been using the TabBar color styles, but iOS was using global foreground, background, unselected. This aligns to use the expected styles on iOS as well.

Renamed the variables to be consistent with Color suffix. 

### API Changes ###

none

### Platforms Affected ### 

- iOS

### Behavioral/Visual Changes ###

iOS tabs now use the right colors.

### Before/After Screenshots ### 

Before:

https://www.screencast.com/t/VDEtS3C0tXd

![tabs-before](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/41873/51805356-da235000-2231-11e9-9fd4-10de47e0d5f8.png)

After:

https://www.screencast.com/t/39tIy6OHfaZ6


![tabs-after](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/41873/51805389-34241580-2232-11e9-945f-66fb5fe9990d.png)



### Testing Procedure ###

Look at it!

### PR Checklist ###

- [ ] Has automated tests
- [x] Rebased on top of the target branch at time of PR
- [x] Changes adhere to coding standard

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[WiP] Cake build script" (#5074) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###
Set of cake targets for easily building/packaging/deploying Forms

### Targets
- Clean for removing bin/objs
- Build for just building SLN
- NugetPack for packing into nugets 
  - ./build.ps1 -Target NugetPack -ScriptArgs '-packageVersion="9.9.9-custom"'
  - Currently only works on windows but could create a nuspec for ios or could convert nuspec files to nuspecsettings in cake
- VSMAC builds the correct multi targeted projects and opens the SLN in vmac.
  - Currently there's a multi targeting bug with VSM that doesn't let it be opened
- DeployAndroid builds an apk and deploys it to a connected device and starts the gallery. 
  - useful for putting up a new apk when running ui tests

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Black page when no ShellContent.Content.BackgroundColor" (#5073) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description
When no background is set on the ShellContent.Content, the below screenshot happens.
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Make a default Shell app, not setting the background anywhere.

### Expected Behavior
A default Shell experience.

### Actual Behavior
A black screen, reminiscent of yee olden XP.
### Basic Information

- Version with issue:
- Last known good version: This is the first time I've tried a Shell app
- IDE: VS 2017
- Platform Target Frameworks:
  - Android: 9, 8.1
- Nuget Packages: Xamarin.Forms: 4.0.0.94569-pre3
- Affected Devices: All emulators I've tried

### Screenshots

After closing flyout, which did look fine.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/160958/51794849-bff15f80-21a8-11e9-8772-eef78daf0170.png)


### Reproduction Link

<!-- Please upload or provide a link to a reproduction case -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[iOS,Android] Add status bar height to DeviceInfo" (#5072) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###

On iOS and Android it can be helpful to know how tall the status bar is when doing things like layout and animation

### API Changes ###

Added:
DeviceInfo.cs
public abstract double StatusBarHeight { get; }


### Platforms Affected ### 

- Core/XAML (all platforms)
- iOS
- Android

### Behavioral/Visual Changes ###

None

### Testing Procedure ###

Run new `StatusBarHeight`  test and manually verify the reported  height.

### PR Checklist ###

- [x] Has automated tests <!-- (if tests are omitted or manual, state reason in description) -->
- [x] Rebased on top of the target branch at time of PR
- [x] Changes adhere to coding standard

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[iOS,FontImageSource] Shell tab icons don't tint" (#5071) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description

I can use FontImageSource to set tab icons, but they aren't accepting the iOS tint color as expected. In this example, the center tab is a PNG and the others are font glyphs. I suspect we need to do something to treat this image format as a template.

https://www.screencast.com/t/C8YY4PYBO2

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 4.0-pre3

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Xcode 10.2 requires macOS Mojave, so make Mojave the main build bot version." (#5493) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
Also cherry-pick a commit in relevant code from master, to minimize merge
problems later.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[cloudkit] Update for xcode 10.2 beta 1" (#5485) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Merged pull request "[javascriptcore] Update for xcode 10.2 beta 1" (#5487) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
The only new API is a p/invoke but we only bound the ObjC (not the C) API
so the entry is moved to the common ignore file for the framework

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[msbuild] Fixes Microsoft.NET.Build.Extensions.Tasks.dll path" (#5492) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
Replaces the hardcoded path to Microsoft.NET.Build.Extensions.Tasks.dll by the MicrosoftNETBuildExtensionsTasksAssembly property. The assembly is in a different location in dev16.

Also removed the old condition that only applied to VS 2015 and early builds of 2017 where the assembly did not exist.

Bug 778800 - Certain iOS projects are failing to build against dev16 seemingly due to a netstandard resolution issue
Fixes https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/778800

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[msbuild] Fixes Microsoft.NET.Build.Extensions.Tasks.dll path" (#5491) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
Replaces the hardcoded path to Microsoft.NET.Build.Extensions.Tasks.dll by the MicrosoftNETBuildExtensionsTasksAssembly property. The assembly is in a different location in dev16.

Also removed the old condition that only applied to VS 2015 and early builds of 2017 where the assembly did not exist.

Bug 778800 - Certain iOS projects are failing to build against dev16 seemingly due to a netstandard resolution issue
Fixes https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/778800

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed pull request "[MetalPerformanceShaders] Update bindings from Xcode 9.2 to 10.1 - Part 1 of 2" (#5466) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
Fixes: xamarin/xamarin-macios#5362

This includes updates for:

* MetalPerformanceShaders.framework
* MPSCore.framework
* MPSImage.framework
* MPSMatrix.framework
* MPSRayIntersector.framework

Pending:

* MPSNeuralNetwork.framework

Due to the size and complexity of `MPSNeuralNetwork` it will come in a different PR as this one is already long enough.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[MetalPerformanceShaders] Update bindings from Xcode 9.2 to 10.2 - Part 1 of 2" (#5490) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
Fixes: xamarin/xamarin-macios#5362

This includes updates for:

* MetalPerformanceShaders.framework
* MPSCore.framework
* MPSImage.framework
* MPSMatrix.framework
* MPSRayIntersector.framework

Pending:

* MPSNeuralNetwork.framework

This also includes a couple of cherry-picked commits that are needed so the metal performance shaders work applies cleanly and it does not create more merge hell when this branch is merged into master.
